skill.name: backlink-analyzer
skill.description: Use when the user asks to "analyze backlinks", "check link profile", "find toxic links", "link building opportunities", "off-page SEO", "who links to me", "I have spammy links", "how do I get more backlinks", or "disavow links". Analyzes backlink profiles to understand link authority, identify toxic links, discover link building opportunities, and monitor competitor link acquisition. Essential for off-page SEO strategy. For internal link analysis, see internal-linking-optimizer. For competitor link profiles, see competitor-analysis.
skill.summary: Use when the user asks to "analyze backlinks", "check link profile", "find toxic links", "link build...
skill.author: aaron-he-zhu

security_audit.summary: All 78 static findings are false positives. The external_commands detection (32 locations) flagged markdown code blocks showing example prompts. Network findings (3 locations) are example URLs in documentation tables. Filesystem findings (12 locations) are markdown relative links. Weak crypto and system reconnaissance findings are triggered by generic SEO terms like 'check' and 'analyze' in legitimate context. This is a standard SEO skill with no malicious code.

dangerous_patterns.title: Markdown Code Blocks Flagged as Shell Execution
dangerous_patterns.description: Static scanner detected backtick syntax in markdown as Ruby/shell backtick execution. These are example prompts like 'Analyze backlink profile for [domain]' - not actual shell commands.

dangerous_patterns.title: Example URLs in Documentation
dangerous_patterns.description: Hardcoded URLs flagged are example anchor text examples (e.g., https://acmecrm.com) in documentation tables, not actual network endpoints.

dangerous_patterns.title: Markdown Relative Links as Path Traversal
dangerous_patterns.description: References like '../../CONNECTORS.md' are markdown relative link paths, not filesystem path traversal vulnerabilities.

content.user_title: Analyze Backlinks and Find Link Building Opportunities
content.value_statement: This skill helps SEO professionals analyze backlink profiles to identify toxic links, discover link building opportunities, and monitor competitor link acquisition strategies.
actual_capabilities: Analyze complete backlink profiles with authority metrics
Identify toxic or harmful links requiring disavowal
Discover link building opportunities through competitor gap analysis
Compare backlink profiles across multiple competitors
Generate professional backlink reports with actionable recommendations
Track new and lost links over time
limitations: Requires external backlink data source for full analysis
Cannot access live SEO databases directly
Competitor data limited to publicly available information
Does not perform actual link building or outreach

use_cases.title: SEO Agency Audit
use_cases.description: Analyze client backlink profiles to identify toxic links and create disavow files for Google Search Console submission.
use_cases.target_user: SEO agencies managing multiple client websites

use_cases.title: Competitor Research
use_cases.description: Discover link building opportunities by finding domains that link to competitors but not to your site.
use_cases.target_user: In-house SEO specialists and marketing teams

use_cases.title: Link Monitoring
use_cases.description: Track new and lost backlinks over time to understand link velocity and identify sudden changes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Backlink Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the backlink profile for [domain]. Include total backlinks, referring domains, domain authority distribution, and identify any toxic links.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a quick overview of a website's link profile

prompt_templates.title: Toxic Link Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Check [domain] for toxic backlinks. Identify high-risk links that should be disavowed and provide the domains and URLs for the disavow file.
prompt_templates.scenario: When preparing for a Google disavowal submission

prompt_templates.title: Competitor Link Gap Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Find link building opportunities by analyzing [competitor domains]. Identify domains linking to them but not to [your domain].
prompt_templates.scenario: When developing a link acquisition strategy

prompt_templates.title: Full Backlink Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive backlink analysis report for [domain] including profile overview, quality assessment, toxic links, competitor comparison, and recommended actions.
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating a detailed SEO audit report

output_examples.output:
## Backlink Profile Overview

**Domain**: example.com
**Total Backlinks**: 1,247
**Referring Domains**: 389
**Domain Authority**: 67

### Key Findings
- Profile health score: 78/100
- High-quality links (DA 50+): 234 (19%)
- Toxic links identified: 12 (1%)

### Recommendations
1. Disavow 12 toxic domains
2. Pursue 45 link intersection opportunities
3. Monitor 23 new links from last month

output_examples.input: Find link building opportunities for mysite.com vs competitors
output_examples.output:
## Link Building Opportunities

### Sites Linking to Competitors (Not You)
| Domain | DA | Competitors | Priority |
|--------|-----|-------------|----------|
| g2.com | 91 | All 3 | High |
| entrepreneur.com | 92 | 2 of 3 | High |

### Top Opportunities
1. **G2.com** - Submit product for review
2. **Entrepreneur.com** - Pitch guest article

best_practices: Always verify backlink data source and freshness before analysis
Focus on quality over quantity when evaluating link opportunities
Regularly monitor for new and lost links to catch issues early
Use competitor analysis to find proven link building strategies
anti_patterns: Do not disavow all low-DA links - they can be valuable for diversity
Avoid chasing exact match anchor text - natural link profiles are mixed
Do not ignore lost links - they may indicate technical issues
Avoid analyzing domains without sufficient backlink data

faq.question: What data do I need to provide for a backlink analysis?
faq.answer: You can provide a backlink export CSV from tools like Ahrefs, Moz, or SEMrush. Include source domains, anchor text, and link types for best results.

faq.question: Can this skill access live SEO databases?
faq.answer: No, this skill analyzes data you provide. For live data access, connect your preferred SEO tool through the connectors system.

faq.question: How does the skill identify toxic links?
faq.answer: It uses the Link Quality Rubric to evaluate factors like domain authority, topical relevance, link position, and known spam indicators.

faq.question: Can I compare multiple competitors?
faq.answer: Yes, you can analyze up to 3-5 competitor domains simultaneously to find link gap opportunities.

faq.question: Does this create disavow files?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates domain and URL lists formatted for Google Search Console disavowal submission.

faq.question: What is link intersection analysis?
faq.answer: It finds domains that link to your competitors but not to your site - these are prime outreach opportunities.
